posts.message:
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/PlhaPhN.png[/IMG][/align]

[align=center]The edition you are currently reading is the [color=white][b]#236th edition[/b] of the HF News[/color]. To read any older editions of the HF News, please go [url=http://bitly.com/1FnhESq]here[/url].[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/vS4lGez.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Gauth 2FA Finally Here![/color][/b]
After much anticipation, Hack Forums' very own 2 factor authentication system has finally been implemented and is now in beta for all Ub3r or 3p1c members to use. The system currently protects only the actual log in, however [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has announced intentions to include it in email/password changes. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4774470]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Accounts now Lockable to Country[/color][/b]
Following the recent spike in changes, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has released a new feature for Ub3r and 3p1c members. Accounts can now be locked to their country; blocking access to any log in attempt located in a foreign country. It can be toggled in case members are travelling but remember to do so before you leave. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4773043]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Disputers now Publicly Shamed[/color][/b]
As if the PayPal blacklist wasn't enough of a deterrent, members who feel the need to dispute their upgrade payment will receive a closed account with their full payment information including name, full address, telephone number, email, and IP address. [i][size=x-small][url=http://nsfw.hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4781892]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/BauioFw.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]User News[/b][/color]
[list][*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=642769][color=#00AAFF][b]Infinity ツ[/b][/color][/url] has reached 1,000 positive reputation.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1302310][color=#00AAFF][b]Crypto Miner[/b][/color][/url] has reached 1,000 positive reputation.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=777][color=#EFEFEF][b]Cooligan[/b][/color][/url] has reached 1,000 positive reputation.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1061502][color=#EFEFEF][b]мr. X[/b][/color][/url] has reached 1,000 positive reputation.[/list]

[color=white][b]Bans[size=x-small]*[/size][/b][/color]
[list][*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1610871][color=black][b]Rʏᴀɴ Rᴇʏɴᴏʟᴅs[/b][/color][/url] was banned for proxy selling.[/list]

[color=white][b]Vacations[/b][/color]
[list][*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1284627][color=black][b]Dean Winchester‎[/b][/color][/url] took a vacation ban.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1320379][color=black][b]Squidward[/b][/color][/url] took a vacation ban.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1670702][color=black][b]CatSoup[/b][/color][/url] took a vacation ban.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2572841][color=black][b]Chаos[/b][/color][/url] took a vacation ban.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1645227][color=black][b]Lovol[/b][/color][/url] took a vacation ban.[/list]

[color=white][b]Closures[/b][/color]
[list][*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=872076][color=#383838][b]Mahdy[/b][/color][/url] was closed for continuous donation begging.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1777126][color=#383838][b]nickchan[/b][/color][/url] was closed.
[/list]

[color=white][b]Repfucks[/b][/color]
[list][*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=872076][color=#383838][b]Mahdy[/b][/color][/url] was repfucked.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1777126][color=#383838][b]nickchan[/b][/color][/url] was repfucked.
[*] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1610871][color=black][b]Rʏᴀɴ Rᴇʏɴᴏʟᴅs[/b][/color][/url] was repfucked.
[/list]

[color=white][b]Awards[/b][/color]
[list][*] No notable awards were given out this week.[/list]

[align=right][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color] - As of the Monday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/5bMUcnt.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4781892][b]Name and Shame Policy[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient [/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]If you reverse your upgrade payment, you can expect a name and shame on your profile. 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4773043][b]Country Locking[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient [/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]You can now lock your country code. Only the  HF account that have this enabled can be accessed to the country code that is locked. This feature is currently only for 3p1c and Ub3r members. 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4777942][b]Beta: Trust Scan[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]A new beta feature which gives you statistics that could assist you in making a choice to trust a member in a deal or not.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4774470][b]Gauth 2-Factor Authentication[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient [/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]All Ub3r members are now able to protect their accounts with Gauth (2FA). 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4778683&pid=45708417#pid45708417][b]Gauth For 3P1C[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]3P1C members now have the ability to use Gauth (2FA) on their accounts.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4773004][b]HFNT // Become a Journalist - Apply now![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][b][color=white]iHydra[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The HFNT has open its doors for new blood. You can now apply to become a Journalist. 

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4773868][b]Orchid's Voice Feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2154389][b][color=white]Orchid[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Orchid has blessed us with his feedback thread which has got a lot of attention from other members.

[b][color=white][u]Group Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4786957][b][color=white]Vibe Official Group Userbar [$50][/color][/b][/url]
[color=transparent]---[/color]PositiveEnergy is rebranding Fortune into Vibe and they are looking for new group graphics. Give it a shot and make them their group graphics.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4787946][b][color=white]Zed Official Group Userbar [$75 + Membership][/color][/b][/url]
[color=transparent]---[/color]zSerity is looking for group graphics for his new group, Zed. Check out his request and if you're a designer, you should make a userbar and see how he likes it.

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/XpMNHm2.png[/img][/align]

[i]Skipped for this Edition[/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[b][color=white]Happy Birthday Omnicoin[/color][/b]
It's been a trying year, but Omnicoin has done amazingly in a relatively short time. With rapid growth, amazing growth in adoption, and already surpassing some altcoins that are more mature. The community support, the projects started by all the talented developers, the awesome physical Omnicoins, and more. It's fantastic to see how far this coin has come, and how far it still has to go.

[align=right][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color] - As of the Friday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/l55r4R7.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]Interviews[/b][/color]
Starting with Edition 237, we will be cutting down the number of interviews a week from two to one. The reason for this is that not a lot happens to everyone that many can relate to every week. When we have two interviews a week, we are using up double the interviews that you can imagine are in a pool of potential interviews. This allows us to stretch it out and keep it less saturated to everyone.

[color=white][b]Breaking News Mini-Editions[/b][/color]
We've heard and understand that each week, the edition contains somewhat outdated information and new information of that week is not in it. This is because our sections are submitted by Friday and go through a process of compilation and editing that occurs on Saturday and Sunday. Monday is publishing day where we finish everything up and publish the edition. What we will begin doing is publishing Breaking News editions which will be very short and sweet. They will contain content that needs to be delivered in a timely manner. Community changes like a breach in the servers or a big new feature such as the vouch system that Omni has said to be planned for the near future. Accompanied with these informative and in-depth news briefs will be World News. World News will be removed from the main edition and will only be made in the Breaking News because it will be updated to that date when it all occurred. This is still a work in progress system so we may change up what I've said.

[color=white][b]HFNT Userscript[/b][/color]
With the introduction of Breaking News editions, we are looking into getting a notification system in the form of a userscript setup. This userscript will alert the member of any new editions posted. You will be able to dismiss the notice and it won't appear again on refresh. It will be a clean notification system that will look like a PM but in a different color and with text indicting either the main edition or breaking news edition has been published. No need to constantly check the subforum if a new edition has been posted.

[color=gold][b]HFNT Recruiting[/b][/color]
HFNT is looking for new journalists so if you are interested, make sure to apply. The thread is located [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4773004]here[/url].

[color=transparent]      [/color]
posts.subject: HF News // Edition 236

posts.message:
[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/B93DARr.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][b]New Hidden Market for 0-Days[/b][/color]
With the downfall of Silk Road, the Armory, and several other popular anonymous marketplaces, many have attempted to take their places in the limelight. A new market dubbed [url=http://trdealmgn4uvm42g.onion/]The Real Deal[/url] has begun selling only the most contemporary and effective exploits, programs, source codes, and hacking services. Though there are other open-internet marketplaces that sell these things, TheRealDeal focuses on malicious, high quality, rigorously tested exploits that are, needless to say, very expensive. A claimed method to hack into any iCloud account is currently being sold for over $17,000 dollars in Bitcoins. The seller is also willing to set up a demonstration to hack the iCloud account of your choosing. Also among these exploits, it sells eBooks on carding and other nefarious activities, RATs for gathering Credit Card info from Points-of-Sale, exploit kits, and account login information, many of which are available for under $20, along with illegal substances, both prescription and recreational, and firearms/weaponry. Though the market is still very small, it is presumed by many that it will grow to nearly the size of the Silk Road by the end of the year. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.wired.com/2015/04/therealdeal-zero-day-exploits/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]An 18-Year Old Vulnerability Comes Back to Life![/b][/color]
In 1997, a vulnerability was reported for Windows XP and NT 3.51 and 4.0 which allowed computers to automatically attempt to authenticate to an SMB Server with the Username, Domain, and hashed LANMAN/NTLM password. Though this is only a surprise to people who don't work in the field of networking and security, it is nonetheless deplorable that such a simple and effective attack has gone unpatched for so long. Through a Man-in-the-Middle attack (MitM), an attacker can forward requests to an SMB server, thus forcing the machine to authenticate. The attacker is then able to intercept the domain-level password hashes which can then be used to authenticate to other domain services via Pass the Hash or NTLM Relay. Even tools available for Android devices allow for relaying these NTLM authentication requests over HTTP protocols, though there are much more robust, professional frameworks available for Linux-based devices that support relaying over many other protocols. Programs such as Adobe Reader, Quicktime, Outlook, and NFS Shares add to this vulnerability. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2015/04/14/unpatched_18_yearold_windows_maninthemiddle_diddle_revived/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Snowden Recommends Passphrases[/b][/color]
To all of us interested in security, a weak password is, perhaps, the easiest way to compromise an account or system. Using common words, birthdays, pet names, etc, has proved, time and time again, to be an effective way to gaining access to someone's private information. Edward Snowden, among many other security professionals, recommends that we move from passwords, which are notoriously easy to crack and hard to remember, to pass-phrases. For example, the popular tech-friendly webcomic XKCD released [url=https://xkcd.com/936/]this comic[/url] highlighting that passwords that seem complex to humans are easily breakable by computers, but phrases have much higher amounts of entropy and are therefore much more difficult to attack. Snowden, on the Tonight Show, recommended using a phrase and gave the example "MargretThatcherIs110%SEXY" over simple passwords such as "passwerd," "onetwothreefour," and "limpbiscuit4eva," since it is much more memerable and much more resistant to brute force and dictionary attacks. If having a highly-acclaimed, world-renowned security expert describe the implications of having weak passwords is not reason enough to increase your security, you should not be surprised when your accounts become compromised. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.wired.com/2015/04/snowden-sexy-margaret-thatcher-password-isnt-so-sexy/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/2OHarSx.png[/img][/align]

[b]Ransomware Telsacrypt Still Targeting Gamers[/b]
There has been new strain of Ransomware known as Telsacrypt, has been popping up recently with targeting gamers and has been making the rounds across the internet. Researchers have found exploit kits such as Sweet Orange and Angler dropping malware on thousands of PCs over the last few months. Brad Duncan, a researcher at SANS InfoSec Community Forums, discovered yet another kit known as the Nuclear Exploit Kit, dropping another variant of this malware. In a blog post last Wednesday, Duncan pointed out that this kit was infecting machines through an exploit of an outdated version of Flash Player (13.0.0.182). Once a machine gets infected, Telsacrypt tells the user that all of their personal files are encrypted and the only way to get them decrypted is to pay 2.5 BTC ($550 USD). [size=x-small][i][url=https://threatpost.com/ransomware-teslacrypt-still-targeting-gamers/112304]>>Source[/url][/i][/size]

[b]Google Shuts Off NPAPI in Chrome[/b]
With Chrome 42 being released last week, Google has fixed over 40 vulnerabilities in the Google Chrome Web Browser. The most significant change in this update is disabling NPAPI, which turned off Java and Silverlight by default. This change didn't come out of no where, as Google warned developers and users well over a year ago about how Chrome handles plugins. As NPAPI has been around since the 1990's, it is an outdated API. It is the leading cause of hangs and crashes, along with other bugs. Users can temporarily enable NPAPI through chrome://flags/#enable-npapi, but later this year with the release of Chrome 45, it will completely be removed from the browser. [size=x-small][i][url=https://threatpost.com/google-shuts-off-npapi-in-chrome/112295]>>Source[/url][/i][/size]

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Mo21ICN.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[b][color=white]Deus Ex: Mankind Divided Announced for Next-Gen Consoles[/color][/b]
On April 8th, 2015, Jean-Francois Dugas announced through the official Playstation Blog that Deus Ex: Mankind Divided would be the next game in the Deus Ex franchise. Coming with this announcement was a trailer for the game, which can be found [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uvSs5b6y-YM]here[/url]. The setting for the game, as taken from the official Playstation Blog post, reads as follows: “The game takes place in 2029, two years after the events of Human Revolution and the infamous ‘Aug Incident’ in Panchaea, which ended the golden era of human augmentation. These terrible events scarred the world and caused augmented people to be segregated and deemed as outcasts.” While the official release is coming from the official Playstation Blog, the game has also been announced to be released on Microsoft’s Xbox One and Microsoft Windows. There is currently no scheduled release date for Deus Ex: Mankind Divided. [i][size=x-small][url=http://blog.us.playstation.com/2015/04/08/deus-ex-mankind-divided-revealed-for-ps4/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Shadow of the Beast Off-Screen Shots Leaked[/color][/b]
Off-screen shots of the Playstation 4 version of Shadow of the Beast have been leaked online. There isn’t very much context behind the pictures, but it’s been inferred that they were taken at a Sony-focused event in the United Kingdom. What appears in the image is an in-game screen showing what appears to be a side-scrolling game. Shadow of the Beast was first announced in 2013 and was accompanied by a CGI trailer then, but very little has been seen or heard of it since. Further details regarding the game are expected to make themselves present soon. The images can be found [url=http://s.pro-gmedia.com/videogamer/media/images/pub/605x/shadow_of_the_beast11.jpg]here[/url] and [url=http://s.pro-gmedia.com/videogamer/media/images/pub/605x/shadow_of_the_beast1.jpg]here[/url]. The original CGI trailer from 2013 can be found [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cWOsd-x6O9Q]here[/url]. 
Off-screen shots of the Playstation 4 version of Shadow of the Beast have been leaked online. There isn’t very much context behind the pictures, but it’s been inferred that they were taken at a Sony-focused event in the United Kingdom. What appears in the image is an in-game screen showing what appears to be a side-scrolling game. Shadow of the Beast was first announced in 2013 and was accompanied by a CGI trailer then, but very little has been seen or heard of it since. Further details regarding the game are expected to make themselves present soon. The images can be found [url=http://s.pro-gmedia.com/videogamer/media/images/pub/605x/shadow_of_the_beast11.jpg]here[/url] and [url=http://s.pro-gmedia.com/videogamer/media/images/pub/605x/shadow_of_the_beast1.jpg]here[/url]. The original CGI trailer from 2013 can be found [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cWOsd-x6O9Q]here[/url].

[b][color=white]2K Australia Closing Down[/color][/b]
2K Australia has been confirmed to be shutting down. All current employees of 2K Australia are set to either lose their job or be reassigned to different areas. While the initial report came from an anonymous source reporting to [url=http://www.kotaku.com.au/2015/04/2k-australia-in-canberra-closes-its-doors/]Kotaku Australia[/url], an official representative of 2K sent an official statement to the gaming news site Polygon, which reads as follows: “We can confirm we have taken steps to begin the studio closure process for 2K Australia in order to better manage ongoing development costs while improving the working proximity of our creative teams. We are very grateful for the team's valuable contributions to numerous 2K projects, and are working with affected staff to explore reassignment opportunities where possible.” The last full game to have been developed by 2K Australia was [i]Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel[/i]. 2K Australia was most known for developing games for both 2K and Irrational Games, the latter of which was shut down in 2014. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.polygon.com/2015/4/15/8425885/2k-australia-closing]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]


[b][color=white]Release date for upcoming games in 2015:[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Final Fantasy VII - PS4 - June, TBA
[/list]
[list]
[*]Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited - PS4, XB1 - June 9, 2015
[/list]
[list]
[*]The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - XB1, PS4, PC - May 19, 2015 
[/list]
[list]
[*]Wolfenstein: The Old Blood  - XB1 -  May 5, 2015 
[/list]
[list]
[*]State of Decay: Year One Survival Edition - XB1 - April 28, 2015
[/list]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week 
[video=youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hNgoPWF1kY0[/video][/align]

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/EotfHs3.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[b][color=white]Samsung builds 200-person team to handle Apple's display needs[/color][/b]
Samsung Display, the mobile conglomerate's screen-producing subsidiary, has assembled a standalone team of about 200 employees who will work exclusively on products for Apple devices, including iPads and MacBooks. The creation of the new Apple display team at Samsung Display Co. comes as the world’s biggest technology companies work to strengthen business ties according to a report by BloombergBusiness. The team is focused on development, as well as sales.

Samsung is relying more on its display and semiconductor units after falling into a tie with Apple for leadership of the global smartphone market. Relations between the companies thawed after they dropped all lawsuits against each other outside the U.S., and Apple is now the biggest external customer for Samsung components, one of the people familiar said. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-04-15/samsung-said-to-create-apple-team-in-display-unit-to-boost-ties]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Samsung, in a race to build your next smartphone chip, may just win[/color][/b]
Samsung, the world's biggest maker of smartphones and TVs, is also dead serious about chips. CNET highlighted how Samsung is planning to spend $15 billion over the next few years to open a semiconductor facility in South Korea by 2017. The company is also implementing three new chip-making techniques at once, versus the industry standard of learning/implementing one at a time. The jump ahead could lead to low yields, but Samsung appears to be capitalizing on the risk with new customers and a bigger slice of the market. 

For example, Samsung surprised plenty of market watchers when it announced 14-nanometer chip technology months ahead of peer Taiwan Semi (NYSE: TSM). While TSM is moving to implement the technology, being several months behind could cost customers and, ultimately, revenue that could be used to advance its R&D process. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.cnet.com/news/samsung-in-a-race-to-build-your-next-smartphone-chip-may-just-win/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]China Halts Implementation of Banking-Technology Rules[/color][/b]
China has suspended plans to heavily regulate technology in the banking industry that would favor domestic producers at the expense of foreign imports, according to a notice issued to banks. The decision follows protests by US officials and businesses who said it would exclude them from the Chinese market. Washington has been lobbying Beijing on the issue and a number of other new cyber security rules, including a draft counter-terrorism law, as well as new data transfer restrictions.

The notice, reviewed by The Wall Street Journal, said rules intended to improve the security of technology used by banks in China had been suspended until further notice while regulators consider feedback from the lenders. It didn’t offer details as to when China might release revised rules. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.wsj.com/articles/china-halts-implementation-of-banking-tech-guidelines-1429181094]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]

[color=transparent]         [/color]
